sense.name: tie or secure, as with a strap
sense.examples: Authorities said the woman had strapped the child into his booster seat. So we loaded up our backpacks, strapped on the tripods, and hit the trail. I also have strapped the FXS and FXO ports together. He quickly slid on the tunic and the leather kilt strapped on easily with the belt.

sense.name: tape an injury
sense.examples: The physio has me using ice and said I maybe could have strapped the injury. Rusedski bravely strapped his ankle to try and protect the damaged tendon.

sense.name: flog or whip
sense.examples: Children who misbehaved would be strapped on the hand.

sense.name: sharpen a razor with a strap
sense.examples: Then this outlaw strapped his razor on his boot. The boy strapped the razor with the rapidity of lightning.
